added_paradoxes.name: We Can’t Afford Fairness
added_paradoxes.summary: Equity is too expensive, but inequality always fits the budget.
added_paradoxes.example_quote: We’d love to pay living wages, but think of the shareholders’ feelings.
added_paradoxes.detected_pattern: Moral cost–benefit analysis that never values morality.

added_paradoxes.name: Profit as Planetary Debt
added_paradoxes.summary: Record earnings built on ecological bankruptcy.
added_paradoxes.example_quote: Good news! The quarter was great. Bad news! The biosphere filed for bankruptcy.
added_paradoxes.detected_pattern: Externalized environmental collapse reframed as growth.

added_paradoxes.name: Innovation as Extraction
added_paradoxes.summary: Every breakthrough monetizes a resource once considered sacred or free.

ethical_recalibration_prompts: Translate quarterly profit into kilograms of topsoil lost.
Ask if fairness would really bankrupt a healthy system—or only a parasitic one.
When laughter turns to sighing, the audit is complete.
